command.name: notedvg
command.comments: Note with delay (duration), velocity, and gate length.

command.name: notedv
command.comments: Note with delay and velocity; gate length is 0 (full).

command.name: notevg
command.comments: Note with velocity and gate length; delay (duration) is the same as the last note.

command.name: ldelay
command.comments: Delay for N ticks

command.name: shortvel
command.comments: Set velocity for future short notes.

command.name: ltp
command.comments: Set note track transposition in semitones.

command.name: shortdelay
command.comments: Set the default delay (duration until next note) for short notes.

command.name: legatoon
command.comments: Turn on legato (continuousNotes, i.e. envelope doesn't restart when next note happens).

command.name: legatooff
command.comments: Turn off legato (continuousNotes, i.e. envelope restarts like normal when next note happens).

command.name: linst
command.comments: Set instrument/program. Similar to the channel command, except arguments 0x7f and above are not supported.

command.name: portamento
command.comments: Enable portamento (aka glissando; continuously sliding pitch). X describes the mode of operation somehow using its 0x80 bit and a value 0-5 in its lower-order bits. (Probably 0x80 = set = proportion of next note time, 0x80 = clear = manually specified sweep time.) Y describes the target pitch. Z gives the duration, and is a u8 if the 0x80 bit is set in X, otherwise a var. Note that parsing this data-dependent datatype is not supported by SEQ64! Canon parameter description info: 01-05 are "SWEEP", 81-85 are "ASWEEP" with comment "Set length next notetime". 1="AB1", 2="BA1", 3="ABL", 4="BAL", 5="NBL" with comment "Set basekey before key".

command.name: portamentooff
command.comments: Disable portamento.

command.name: shortgate
command.comments: Set the gate length for future short notes.

command.name: lpan
command.comments: Set the pan for this layer (0…128).

command.name: lenvelope
command.comments: Set envelope for layer, by loading envelope from sequence data and providing release rate separately.

command.name: drumpanoff
command.comments: Ignore drum pan

command.name: reverbphase
command.comments: Canon command comment: "4bit Packed Data (status+phaseside)" Canon other info: 0 = "OVR" = "NON", 1="L", 2="R", 4="DEF", 8="OR", 12="XOR"

command.name: lbend2
command.comments: Pitch bend based on an alternate frequency scale.

command.name: lrelease
command.comments: Set envelope release rate.

command.name: shorttablevel
command.comments: Set the velocity for future short notes to table[N], where table defaults to {12, 25, 38, 51, 57, 64, 71, 76, 83, 89, 96, 102, 109, 115, 121, 127} and can be set by shortnotevelocitytable.

command.name: shorttablegate
command.comments: Set the gate time for future short notes to table[N], where table defaults to {229, 203, 177, 151, 139, 126, 113, 100, 87, 74, 61, 48, 36, 23, 10, 0} and can be set by shortnotedurationtable.

command.name: cdelay
command.comments: Delay by N ticks.

command.name: loadspl
command.comments: Load a sample (probably bank SFX). The sample bank is the current channel's bank ID, the sample number itself is given by Q, and N (cmd offset) is the I/O address to report the sample status in. It is initialized to -1, then set to 0, 2, or 3 based on various states or errors, and then presumably set to 1 when the sample loading finishes.

command.name: loadsplp
command.comments: Load a sample (probably bank SFX). The sample bank is the current channel's bank ID, the sample number itself is given by P + 0x100, and N % 8 is the I/O address to report the sample status in. It is initialized to -1, then set to 0, 2, or 3 based on various states or errors, and then presumably set to 1 when the sample loading finishes.

command.name: startchan
command.comments: Start channel N for the parent sequence, with channel script starting at address X.

command.name: stcio
command.comments: Chan[C].IO[N] = Q, where IO[N] is the IO array for channel C.

command.name: ldcio
command.comments: Q = Chan[C].IO[N], where IO[N] is the IO array for channel C.

command.name: subio
command.comments: Decrease Q by IO[N].

command.name: ldio
command.comments: Q = IO[N]. If N < 2, afterwards sets IO[N] to -1.

command.name: stio
command.comments: Set IO[N] to Q.

command.name: rstartlayer
command.comments: Assigns note layer N to script located at current script location + offset. If note layer N is not allocated, nothing will occur.

command.name: testlayer
command.comments: For note layer N, sets Q to 0 if layer is playing data, 1 if layer is done playing, and -1 if layer is not allocated.

command.name: startlayer
command.comments: If note layer N is allocated, start note layer N with script starting at given address.

command.name: stoplayer
command.comments: Stop note layer N.

command.name: dynstartlayer
command.comments: If Q != -1 and N layer is allocated, start layer N, with layer script given by dyntable[Q].

command.name: setfilter
command.comments: Sets the current filter pointer (within the sequence data) to the given parameter. It's unknown what this filter is used for, but it's an 8-point FIR filter (16 bytes). Maybe something to do with ADPCM codebooks? Or just a generic filter that can be applied to audio?

command.name: clearfilter
command.comments: Sets the current filter pointer to nullptr, disabling use of the filter. See setfilter.

command.name: ldptbl
command.comments: Load pointer from table. P = sequenceData[A + Q]

command.name: copyfilter
command.comments: Copy one or two filters into the sequence data at the current filter pointer. The parameter is of the form XY in hex, where the first and second nybble are each two different filter indices from different banks of filter points in the ROM. If either is 0, only the other filter is copied. If both are nonzero, two are averaged as they are copied. If both are zero, a filter which is just a delayed impulse is used.

command.name: p2dyntable
command.comments: dyntable = data[P]

command.name: dyntable2p
command.comments: P = dyntable[Q]

command.name: lddyn
command.comments: Q = dyntable[Q]

command.name: randp
command.comments: Assigns P to a random value between 0 and Max - 1. If Max == 0, then it will assign it to any value between 0 and 65536.

command.name: rand
command.comments: Assigns Q to a random byte between 0 and Max - 1. If Max == 0, it's assigned any random value between -128 and 127.

command.name: velrand
command.comments: Sets velocityRandomVariance (humanization).

command.name: gaterand
command.comments: Sets gate length humanization (durationRandomVariance).

command.name: unk_BB
command.comments: Sets channel[0xF] to param 1 and channel[0x20] to param 2.

command.name: addp
command.comments: P += immediate

command.name: randaddp
command.comments: First sets P to a new random value between 0 and Max (if Max == 0, then the random value is unbounded). It then adds Value to P and sets the topmost bit to 1.

command.name: instr
command.comments: Set instrument (program?) within bank. 0x80-0x83 set raw waves (sawtooth, triangle, sine, square), 0x7f is special, otherwise 0-indexed. Canon info: 80 saw, 01 triangle ("delta"), 02 sine, 03 square ("pulse"), 06 "pulse0", 07 "pulse1"

command.name: dyntable
command.comments: Set dyntable to point to a given u16 array from the sequence data.

command.name: shorton
command.comments: Set notes for this channel to use “short notes” format.

command.name: shortoff
command.comments: Set notes for this channel to use “large notes” format. SM64 does this for all channels.

command.name: dynsetdyntable
command.comments: If Q != -1, set dyntable to point to position dyntable[Q] in the sequence data.

command.name: bank
command.comments: Switch bank within instrument bank sets, to the X’th bank, 0-indexed, counting from the end.

command.name: sts
command.comments: Self-Modifying Code -- sequenceData[A] = Q + imm

command.name: sub
command.comments: Q -= val

command.name: and
command.comments: Q &= val

command.name: mutebhv
command.comments: Set mute behavior for this channel.

command.name: lds
command.comments: Introspection -- Q = sequenceData[A + Q].

command.name: ldi
command.comments: Q = val

command.name: stopchan
command.comments: Disable channel N for the parent sequence.

command.name: ldpi
command.comments: Load pointer with immediate. P = value

command.name: stps
command.comments: Store pointer to sequence. Self-modifying code -- sequenceData[A] = P. A need not be 2-byte aligned.

command.name: stereoheadseteffects
command.comments: 0x80 enables or disables "stereoheadseteffects". 0x7F is stored to reverb bits.

command.name: noteallocpolicy
command.comments: Set note allocation policy (bitmask). If bit 0x1 is set, it will try to steal notes back from what was previously played on the same layer. If bit 0x2 is set, notes will be allocated exclusively from the channel’s reserved notes, else if 0x4 is set, from the channel’s or sequence’s reserved notes, else if 0x8 is set, from unreserved notes, otherwise from all sources. Canon info basically matches this: 0=poly, 1=mono, 2="LIMIT_INSUB" (channel), 4="LIMIT_INGROUP" (seq), 8="LIMIT_GLOBAL"

command.name: sustain
command.comments: Set envelope sustain volume

command.name: pitchbend
command.comments: Pitch bend by <= 1 octave in either direction (-127…127).

command.name: reverb
command.comments: Set amount of reverb (dry/wet mix).

command.name: vibfreq
command.comments: Set vibrato frequency / rate. Actually sets the vibrato rate envelope to start = target = parameter, delay = 0.

command.name: vibdepth
command.comments: Set vibrato depth. Actually sets the vibrato depth envelope to start = 0, target = parameter, delay = 0.

command.name: release
command.comments: Set envelope release rate.

command.name: cenvelope
command.comments: Load channel envelope from sequence data.

command.name: ctp
command.comments: Channel transposition in semitones.

command.name: panmix
command.comments: How much to weight channel pan vs. note pan. The pan for each note will be computed as W * channel pan + (1 - W) * note pan. This sets W (0…128 maps to 0…1). W defaults to 1.0.

command.name: cpan
command.comments: Set the pan for this channel (0…128)

command.name: freqscale
command.comments: Pitch bend using a raw frequency multiplier X/2^15.

command.name: cvol
command.comments: Set channel volume scale factor (MIDI range 0-127, but accepts through 255 and will go louder). This corresponds to MIDI volume (CC 7).

command.name: cexp
command.comments: Set channel expression (second volume scale factor) (MIDI range 0-127, but accepts through 255 and will go louder). This corresponds to MIDI expression (CC 11).

command.name: vibfreqenv
command.comments: Set vibrato frequency for each note as a function that starts at X, goes up linearly to Y over a time span given by Z, then stays there.

command.name: vibdepthenv
command.comments: Set vibrato depth for each note as a function that starts at X, goes up linearly to Y over a time span given by Z, then stays there.

command.name: vibdelay
command.comments: Set delay until vibrato starts for each note.

command.name: dyncall
command.comments: If Q != -1, make a function call to position dyntable[Q], where dyntable is a channel-specific u16 array which can set by dyntable/dynsetdyntable.

command.name: reverbidx
command.comments: Set reverb index (??)

command.name: splvari
command.comments: Sets bookOffset (sample variation?)

command.name: ldcparams
command.comments: Set channel parameters (muteBehavior, noteAllocPolicy, notePriority, transposition, pan, panChannelWeight, reverb, reverbIndex) from sequence data.

command.name: cparams
command.comments: Set channel parameters (muteBehavior, noteAllocPolicy, notePriority, transposition, pan, panChannelWeight, reverb, reverbIndex) from command.

command.name: notepriority
command.comments: Set priority for notes on this channel.

command.name: halt
command.comments: Set channel to muted

command.name: bankinstr
command.comments: Set bank and program.

command.name: chanreset
command.comments: Reset a whole lot of channel parameters, including vibrato, envelope, and others.

command.name: filgain
command.comments: Filter Gain (sets unk_0C)

command.name: cbend2
command.comments: Pitch bend using an alternate frequency scale (same one as in note layer).

command.name: testchan
command.comments: Sets Q to 1 if channel N is disabled, otherwise sets it to 0.

command.name: stopchan
command.comments: Stops channel C

command.name: subio
command.comments: Q -= sequenceIO[N]

command.name: loadbank
command.comments: Calls func_800E4EEC(bank idx?, bank slot?, sequenceIO[N]). Effects not entirely known, likely loads a bank from the specified slot.

command.name: stio
command.comments: sequenceIO[N] = Q.

command.name: ldio
command.comments: Q = sequenceIO[N]. If N < 2, afterwards sets sequenceIO[N] to -1.

command.name: startchan
command.comments: Enables channel N with the channel script located at the given address.

command.name: rstartchan
command.comments: Enables channel N with the channel script at the relative address.

command.name: loadseq
command.comments: Load new sequence (given index) into current sequence's data at address. sequenceIO[N] is passed as some parameter to that sequence.

command.name: unk_C4
command.comments: Calls func_800E20D4(param1 == -1 ? variation bit : param1, param2, 0). If afterwards, variation bit hasn't changed, return (yield?), otherwise continue parsing. (???)

command.name: unk_C5
command.comments: Sets 0xE0 in seq player to param, which is incremented seemingly once per tick, not sure where it's used.

command.name: unk_C6
command.comments: Sets sequence player bit 1 (0x02), disables further processing of the sequencer after the script has been parsed.

command.name: sts
command.comments: Self-Modifying Code -- sequenceData[A] = Q + imm

command.name: sub
command.comments: Q -= val

command.name: and
command.comments: Q &= val

command.name: ldi
command.comments: Q = val

command.name: tblcall
command.comments: If Q != -1 and call depth not at max (3), make a function call to position sequenceData[A+Q].

command.name: rand
command.comments: Loads Q with a random byte between 0 and Max - 1. If Max == 0, then it will be unbounded.

command.name: noteallocpolicy
command.comments: Set note allocation policy (bitmask). If bit 0x1 is set, it will try to steal notes back from what was previously played on the same layer. If bit 0x2 is set, notes will be allocated exclusively from the channel’s reserved notes, else if 0x4 is set, from the channel’s or sequence’s reserved notes, else if 0x8 is set, from unreserved notes, otherwise from all sources. Not used by the game.

command.name: ldshorttablegate
command.comments: Set gate table for short notes. Target should be an array of bytes in the sequence data of length 16.

command.name: ldshorttablevel
command.comments: Set velocity table for short notes. Target should be an array of bytes in the sequence data of length 16.

command.name: mutebhv
command.comments: Set mute behavior (bitmask). Bit 0x20 lowers volume, bit 0x40 does something to tracks, and bit 0x80 pauses the sequence script. Default mute behavior is to have all of those bits set. Canon parameter names: 80 = "SEQSTOP" = "sequence stop." 40 = "VOICECUT" = "voice stop immediately,and not entry." 20 = "VOLDOWN" = "volume down.(x pausevolume)" 10 = "ENTRYOFF" = "now voice will continue,but next isn't on." 08 = "FREEZE" = "restart OK."

command.name: mute
command.comments: Set sequence to muted mode. Depending on what behavior has been set this will do different things; from lowering volume to not running scripts.

command.name: mutescale
command.comments: Sets volume multiplier for muted mode (0…127).

command.name: disablechan
command.comments: Likely was meant to uninitialize channels (bitmask). Implemented as a no-op.

command.name: initchan
command.comments: Initialize channels, where each bit either enables or disables the channel. Each channel will be initialized with the sequencer's default bank, mute behavior, and note allocation policy.

command.name: sexp
command.comments: Sequence expression (second volume control) (0..127).

command.name: sfade
command.comments: Fade volume over time. Canon info: 0="MOVE", 1="FADEIN", 2="FADEOUT". Sets the sequencer to the provided mode and fade timer. If set to FADEOUT, begins the fade out from the current volume immediately.

command.name: svol
command.comments: Set volume scale (0..127) (higher values are possible but may cause issues with fading). If fade mode is 0, the change takes effect immediately. If fade mode is 1 (fade in), the sequence fades to this new level (up or down) according to the fade time. If fade mode is 2 (fade out), the fadeout continues and this volume command is ignored.

command.name: tempovar
command.comments: Sets temporary tempo variance to V. This value is added on top of the regular tempo while the sequence plays.

command.name: tempo
command.comments: Set tempo in BPM. If new tempo is > current maximum, set tempo to max. If tempo is 0 or less, it will be set to 1.

command.name: stprel
command.comments: Change sequence transposition by semitones.

command.name: stp
command.comments: Sets sequence transposition.

command.name: print
command.comments: No actual operation. Might be used to show specific log values in the audio debugger.

command.name: unreservenotes
command.comments: Drop all earlier reservations made by this sequence/channel.

command.name: reservenotes
command.comments: Reserve X notes for exclusive use by this sequence/channel (dropping earlier reservations). A limited number of notes can be played at once (configurable per level, usually 16); if more than that are played, an existing one will be stopped and reused. This command can prevent that from happening across sequences.

command.name: rbltz
command.comments: Branch Relative if Q < 0

command.name: rbeqz
command.comments: Branch Relative if Q == 0

command.name: rjump
command.comments: Branch Relative Always

command.name: bgez
command.comments: Branch Absolute if Q>=0

command.name: break
command.comments: Decrease loop/function stack depth by 1. Combine with a jump to break out of a loop. Only supported in channels.

command.name: loopend
command.comments: Loop End

command.name: loop
command.comments: Loop Start

command.name: bltz
command.comments: Branch Absolute if Q < 0

command.name: beqz
command.comments: Branch Absolute if Q == 0

command.name: jump
command.comments: Branch Absolute Always

command.name: call
command.comments: Call Absolute

command.name: yield
command.comments: Return from parsing, to pick up from the next command on the next parse cycle. Effectively delay by 1 tick.
